Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate how success, challenge, setbacks and failure strengthen resilience and identities in a range of contexts
Elaboration: Explaining how characters in stories overcome challenge and adversity and achieve success in different ways (MH)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate how success, challenge, setbacks and failure strengthen resilience and identities in a range of contexts
Elaboration: Discussing and acknowledging how Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples’ pride in their cultural background strengthens identities (MH)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate how success, challenge, setbacks and failure strengthen resilience and identities in a range of contexts
Elaboration: Discussing how overcoming challenge or adversity together can unite a group of people (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate how success, challenge, setbacks and failure strengthen resilience and identities in a range of contexts
Elaboration: Exploring strategies individuals can use to show others they accept and value them as a member of a team, class, school and community (MH)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate how success, challenge, setbacks and failure strengthen resilience and identities in a range of contexts
Elaboration: Recognising how success, challenge, failure and enjoyment of games and physical activities in different settings (classroom, playground, outdoor environments) influence identities (AP, CA, GS, MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Plan, rehearse and reflect on strategies to cope with the different changes and transitions they experience, such as physical, social and emotional changes
Elaboration: Discussing physical, social and emotional changes that occur as individuals get older, and exploring how these changes affect the way they think and feel about themselves and different situations (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Plan, rehearse and reflect on strategies to cope with the different changes and transitions they experience, such as physical, social and emotional changes
Elaboration: Identifying people or sources of information they can access if they have questions about the changes that occur during puberty (RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Plan, rehearse and reflect on strategies to cope with the different changes and transitions they experience, such as physical, social and emotional changes
Elaboration: Understanding the nature of family support networks in communities, including for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples, and discussing how a wide range of family and community members support young people when they are going through changes and transitions (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Plan, rehearse and reflect on strategies to cope with the different changes and transitions they experience, such as physical, social and emotional changes
Elaboration: Practising and refining coping skills they can use when faced with challenges or changes, such as positive self-talk, problem-solving, mindfulness, and seeking help from families, peers and teachers (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Plan, rehearse and reflect on strategies to cope with the different changes and transitions they experience, such as physical, social and emotional changes
Elaboration: Identifying scenarios in texts where characters experience and react to change and transition, exploring the effectiveness of these responses and identifying other possible options that may be helpful (RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe how choices and actions can be influenced by stereotypes
Elaboration: Exploring different gender stereotypes in texts and media, and discussing the messages they portray and how they can influence choices and actions (RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe how choices and actions can be influenced by stereotypes
Elaboration: Recognising that unfair or unequal treatment of people based on their gender, abilities or other differences is wrong and against their human rights (RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe how choices and actions can be influenced by stereotypes
Elaboration: Describing ways to make roles and responsibilities at home, at school and in communities fair, equitable and inclusive (RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe how choices and actions can be influenced by stereotypes
Elaboration: Practising ways in which they can contribute to people of different genders and abilities being treated in fair, equitable and inclusive ways (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Select, use and refine personal and social skills to establish, manage and strengthen relationships
Elaboration: Predicting and reflecting on how other students might feel in a range of challenging situations, such as when being excluded from a game or when experiencing name-calling, and discussing what they can do to support them (MH, RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Select, use and refine personal and social skills to establish, manage and strengthen relationships
Elaboration: Describing characters in texts who have demonstrated respect for difference and diversity in individuals and communities, and exploring the strategies they used to do this (RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Select, use and refine personal and social skills to establish, manage and strengthen relationships
Elaboration: Discussing how demonstrating respect and empathy towards people of different cultural backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples, can build positive relationships (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Select, use and refine personal and social skills to establish, manage and strengthen relationships
Elaboration: Recognising that bullying behaviour can take many forms, including online, and proposing strategies to address bullying in and out of school (MH, RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Select, use and refine personal and social skills to establish, manage and strengthen relationships
Elaboration: Describing behaviours that show empathy and respect for the rights of others at home, at school and in the community (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe how valuing diversity influences wellbeing and identify actions that promote inclusion in their communities
Elaboration: Planning ways to celebrate the cultural diversity of students in their class, such as sharing recipes, stories and games from their cultural heritage (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe how valuing diversity influences wellbeing and identify actions that promote inclusion in their communities
Elaboration: Researching and participating in games from their own and others’ cultural heritage, and learning why games are important to build cultural awareness and appreciation (AP, MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe how valuing diversity influences wellbeing and identify actions that promote inclusion in their communities
Elaboration: Identifying behaviours that are respectful, inclusive and safe during play (RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe how valuing diversity influences wellbeing and identify actions that promote inclusion in their communities
Elaboration: Describing and practising safe upstander actions when they notice unfair or disrespectful behaviour towards others (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe how valuing diversity influences wellbeing and identify actions that promote inclusion in their communities
Elaboration: Recognising and understanding the important role of narratives in describing the diversity of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples’ cultures and the cultures of Asia, and sharing beliefs and practices across all cultures (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Explain how and why emotional responses can vary and practise strategies to manage their emotions
Elaboration: Recognising how the depth and strength of their own emotional responses may vary in different situations and practising strategies to manage emotions (MH)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Explain how and why emotional responses can vary and practise strategies to manage their emotions
Elaboration: Reviewing scenarios and identifying possible triggers and warning signs to predict emotional responses (MH)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Explain how and why emotional responses can vary and practise strategies to manage their emotions
Elaboration: Exploring scenarios and identifying how someone might respond in a helpful way during an emergency (S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Explain how and why emotional responses can vary and practise strategies to manage their emotions
Elaboration: Explaining how characters in texts use strategies to identify and manage their emotions before deciding to act (MH)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Explain how and why emotional responses can vary and practise strategies to manage their emotions
Elaboration: Implementing self-regulation strategies to manage the expression of emotional responses (MH)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Practise and refine strategies for seeking, giving and denying permission respectfully and describe situations when permission is required across multiple settings (including online and offline)
Elaboration: Practising and refining strategies for seeking and giving consent; for example, giving consent for their photo to be shared (RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Practise and refine strategies for seeking, giving and denying permission respectfully and describe situations when permission is required across multiple settings (including online and offline)
Elaboration: Exploring actions they can take if someone has done something hurtful or disrespectful to them without their permission or consent, including in online environments (RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Practise and refine strategies for seeking, giving and denying permission respectfully and describe situations when permission is required across multiple settings (including online and offline)
Elaboration: Exploring actions they can take when they or others are unsafe, such as saying no, leaving the situation and reporting the incident, and discussing how to use these strategies in situations such as when someone posts an embarrassing picture online without their permission, touches private parts of their body, or uses violence against them (RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Practise and refine strategies for seeking, giving and denying permission respectfully and describe situations when permission is required across multiple settings (including online and offline)
Elaboration: Exploring a variety of relevant situations where permission or consent may be required and developing an understanding of why permission may be required (RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe and apply protective behaviours and help-seeking strategies in a range of online and offline situations at home, school and in the community
Elaboration: Describing protective behaviours to stay safe in different situations, including water or roads, in the park, when they are online or when someone makes them feel uncomfortable or unsafe (S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe and apply protective behaviours and help-seeking strategies in a range of online and offline situations at home, school and in the community
Elaboration: Describing warning signs (physical, social and external), such as increased heart rate or feeling fear, that can help them to know if they are safe or unsafe (S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe and apply protective behaviours and help-seeking strategies in a range of online and offline situations at home, school and in the community
Elaboration: Identifying trusted adults they can talk to if they feel unsafe and practising how to talk to people if they feel unsafe (MH, RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe and apply protective behaviours and help-seeking strategies in a range of online and offline situations at home, school and in the community
Elaboration: Identifying a range of help-seeking strategies to negotiate positive outcomes when challenging situations arise, such as seeking help from trusted adults when reporting negative or harmful online behaviour (MH, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe and apply protective behaviours and help-seeking strategies in a range of online and offline situations at home, school and in the community
Elaboration: Using texts, videos and online scenarios as sources to discuss different protective behaviours and help-seeking strategies they could use to keep themselves and others safe (MH, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Interpret the nature and intention of health information and messages in their community, and reflect on how these influence personal decisions and behaviours
Elaboration: Accessing different sources of health information and identifying the accuracy of these sources, including brochures, websites, TV shows and advertisements, online promotions and food labels (FN, HBPA, MH, RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Interpret the nature and intention of health information and messages in their community, and reflect on how these influence personal decisions and behaviours
Elaboration: Examining health messages from different sources and exploring choices, behaviours and outcomes conveyed in these messages (AD, FN, HBPA, MH, RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Interpret the nature and intention of health information and messages in their community, and reflect on how these influence personal decisions and behaviours
Elaboration: Investigating the level of influence health messages from different people and sources may have on their health decisions and the validity of these sources of information (AD, FN, HBPA, MH, RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Interpret the nature and intention of health information and messages in their community, and reflect on how these influence personal decisions and behaviours
Elaboration: Researching health messages or campaigns in their community and creating their own campaigns to promote positive health messages, such as creating positive mindset cards for classrooms at school, providing active play equipment at lunchtime, and assembly presentations (AD, FN, HBPA, MH, RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate and apply strategies that contribute to their own and others’ health, safety, relationships and wellbeing
Elaboration: Identifying how medications and other substances can be stored safely in the home and at school (AD, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate and apply strategies that contribute to their own and others’ health, safety, relationships and wellbeing
Elaboration: Reflecting on how the consumption of nourishing foods makes them feel, and how our bodies tell us when we are full or hungry (FN)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate and apply strategies that contribute to their own and others’ health, safety, relationships and wellbeing
Elaboration: Discussing the importance of a sense of belonging and its connection to positive mental health and wellbeing (MH)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate and apply strategies that contribute to their own and others’ health, safety, relationships and wellbeing
Elaboration: Explaining how characters in texts take responsibility for their own and others’ safety in a range of situations, including water and road environments and when in the sun (S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate and apply strategies that contribute to their own and others’ health, safety, relationships and wellbeing
Elaboration: Identifying ways they can change their behaviours to support sustainability in their home, school or community; for example, recycling or composting systems to minimise waste in the school, and community fruit and vegetable gardens to create healthy and sustainable lunches or snacks (FN)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate and apply strategies that contribute to their own and others’ health, safety, relationships and wellbeing
Elaboration: Practising strategies for enhancing mental wellbeing such as positive self-talk, breathing techniques, mindfulness and meditation (MH)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Practise and refine fundamental movement skills in different movement situations, including indoor, outdoor and aquatic settings
Elaboration: Performing activities where locomotor and object control skills are combined to complete a movement, task or challenge, such as dribbling a ball while moving, or moving to catch a ball in a modified court or field game (AP, FMS, GS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Practise and refine fundamental movement skills in different movement situations, including indoor, outdoor and aquatic settings
Elaboration: Exploring and practising different techniques to propel objects towards a range of targets from various distances (AP, FMS, GS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Practise and refine fundamental movement skills in different movement situations, including indoor, outdoor and aquatic settings
Elaboration: Performing fundamental movement skills to demonstrate weight transference in different physical activities, such as when striking, propelling objects and performing locomotor activities (AP, FMS, GS, RE)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Practise and refine fundamental movement skills in different movement situations, including indoor, outdoor and aquatic settings
Elaboration: Refining striking skills using a variety of equipment and exploring modifications to technique when striking for accuracy and distance (AP, FMS, GS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Practise and refine fundamental movement skills in different movement situations, including indoor, outdoor and aquatic settings
Elaboration: Coordinating kicking with arm movements to move the body through the water using different types of strokes (FMS, LLPA, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Practise and apply basic movement strategies to achieve movement outcomes
Elaboration: Planning and performing strategies to be successful in a range of minor and small-sided games such as tag games, target games and net/court games (AP, FMS, GS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Practise and apply basic movement strategies to achieve movement outcomes
Elaboration: Demonstrating how movement strategies can be applied to create scoring opportunities in invasion games (AP, FMS, GS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Practise and apply basic movement strategies to achieve movement outcomes
Elaboration: Manipulating their centre of gravity to enhance stability as they perform a range of balance activities and explaining how centre of gravity and base of support influence stability (AP, FMS, RE)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Practise and apply basic movement strategies to achieve movement outcomes
Elaboration: Reflecting on how the application of a game tactic improved scoring opportunities (AP, FMS, GS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Demonstrate how movement concepts related to effort, space, time, objects and people can be applied when performing movement skills
Elaboration: Demonstrating acceleration, deceleration and changing direction of movement in minor games and rhythmic and expressive activities (AP, FMS, GS, RE)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Demonstrate how movement concepts related to effort, space, time, objects and people can be applied when performing movement skills
Elaboration: Discussing and demonstrating different levels, movement pathways, and use of space and flow in movement sequences, such as when performing a dance routine to music or a simple gymnastics sequence (FMS, RE)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Demonstrate how movement concepts related to effort, space, time, objects and people can be applied when performing movement skills
Elaboration: Using the body to demonstrate an understanding of symmetry, shapes and angles when performing movement skills, balances or movement sequences (AP, FMS, RE)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Demonstrate how movement concepts related to effort, space, time, objects and people can be applied when performing movement skills
Elaboration: Exploring different ways of manipulating space to receive passes, maintain possession, or increase or decrease scoring opportunities in invasion, net/court, striking and fielding, and target games (AP, FMS, GS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Perform movement sequences that link fundamental movement skills
Elaboration: Performing routines incorporating different jumping, landing and balancing techniques, and connecting movements to create a movement sequence (FMS, RE)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Perform movement sequences that link fundamental movement skills
Elaboration: Demonstrating fundamental movement skills in correct sequence to complete a movement task or challenge, such as long jump (FMS, GS, RE)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Perform movement sequences that link fundamental movement skills
Elaboration: Performing floor routines using rolling actions, incline, weight transfer, flight and balances (FMS, RE)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Perform movement sequences that link fundamental movement skills
Elaboration: Participating in dance routines from or inspired by Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples’ cultures and different cultures, such as Tinikling from the Philippines, Polynesian dance and Japanese parasol dance (FMS, RE)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Perform movement sequences that link fundamental movement skills
Elaboration: Using a surface dive to propel the body underwater to recover an object (FMS, LLPA, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in physical activities to explore how their body feels and describe how regular physical activity helps the body stay healthy and well
Elaboration: Exploring how the body feels before, during and after participating in a variety of physical activities (AP, GS, HBPA, LLPA, RE)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in physical activities to explore how their body feels and describe how regular physical activity helps the body stay healthy and well
Elaboration: Investigating the types of physical activities people engage in to maintain health, wellbeing and fitness (HBPA)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in physical activities to explore how their body feels and describe how regular physical activity helps the body stay healthy and well
Elaboration: Performing warm-up and stretching routines to understand how to prepare the body to be active (GS, HBPA, LLPA, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in physical activities to explore how their body feels and describe how regular physical activity helps the body stay healthy and well
Elaboration: Describing their body’s differing responses to physical activities such as yoga versus cross-country running (FMS, HBPA, LLPA, RE)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in physical activities to explore how their body feels and describe how regular physical activity helps the body stay healthy and well
Elaboration: Participating in weight-bearing and high-intensity physical activities such as skipping, running games and climbing activities and explaining how these activities benefit health and physical fitness (HBPA, LLPA)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in physical activities in outdoor environments and aquatic settings to examine contextual factors that can influence their own and others’ safe participation
Elaboration: Participating safely in physical activities in outdoor environments and aquatic settings in the local area and reflecting on the enjoyable components of participation and how to encourage family and friends to participate (AP, CA, HBPA, LLPA, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in physical activities in outdoor environments and aquatic settings to examine contextual factors that can influence their own and others’ safe participation
Elaboration: Discussing and acknowledging Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples’ connection to special places and how these places are linked to physical activities (HBPA)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in physical activities in outdoor environments and aquatic settings to examine contextual factors that can influence their own and others’ safe participation
Elaboration: Participating in outdoor physical activities at home, for example in their backyard and in local parks, and exploring how they can be more active at home using everyday items as equipment (HBPA, LLPA)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in physical activities in outdoor environments and aquatic settings to examine contextual factors that can influence their own and others’ safe participation
Elaboration: Exploring ways in which people can connect with other members of their community through participating in recreation and formal and informal physical activities (HBPA, LLPA, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in physical activities in outdoor environments and aquatic settings to examine contextual factors that can influence their own and others’ safe participation
Elaboration: Participating in physical activities in outdoor environments or aquatic settings where they are challenged to overcome perceived risks, such as safe ways to negotiate climbing equipment (AP, CA, LLPA, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Explore recommendations about physical activity and sedentary behaviours, and discuss strategies to achieve the recommendations
Elaboration: Brainstorming and participating in a range of games and physical activities and identifying those that they enjoy to co-create a bank of movement games that they can play during break times to be more active (AP, HBPA)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Explore recommendations about physical activity and sedentary behaviours, and discuss strategies to achieve the recommendations
Elaboration: Examining the benefits of regular physical activity, including the influence on sleep, concentration and wellbeing, and identifying opportunities when they can be active at school, home and in the community (AP, HBPA, MH)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Explore recommendations about physical activity and sedentary behaviours, and discuss strategies to achieve the recommendations
Elaboration: Exploring recommendations around time spent on screen-based activities in the Australian 24-Hour Movement Guidelines for Children and Young People and developing a plan so they can meet these recommendations (HBPA)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Explore recommendations about physical activity and sedentary behaviours, and discuss strategies to achieve the recommendations
Elaboration: Identifying enablers and barriers to participating in physical activity, such as transport, cost and motivation (HBPA)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Apply creative thinking skills when solving movement problems
Elaboration: Applying fundamental movement skills to solve movement challenges such as how to move a ball from one end of a field to the other, how to strike a ball off a tee into space and how to evade an opponent (AP, FMS, GS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Apply creative thinking skills when solving movement problems
Elaboration: Drawing on prior knowledge from other physical activity experiences to solve challenges faced when participating in outdoor activities, such as initiative games, ropes courses and obstacle courses (AP, CA, FMS, GS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Apply creative thinking skills when solving movement problems
Elaboration: Developing questions and trialling answers with others as a strategy for solving movement challenges, such as partner or group balance challenges, game tactics to increase scoring chances and obstacle course challenges (AP, CA, GS, RE)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Apply creative thinking skills when solving movement problems
Elaboration: Applying different techniques to propel objects towards targets and determining the best method to improve accuracy (AP, FMS, GS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Apply rules and scoring systems to promote fair play and inclusion when participating in or designing physical activities
Elaboration: Collaborating to decide rules for a new game to promote fair play and inclusion of all learners (AP, FMS, GS, RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Apply rules and scoring systems to promote fair play and inclusion when participating in or designing physical activities
Elaboration: Interpreting and applying rules fairly in physical activities where they are in an officiating role (AP, FMS, GS, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Apply rules and scoring systems to promote fair play and inclusion when participating in or designing physical activities
Elaboration: Examining rules and scoring systems used in traditional games of different cultures, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples, and comparing them to rules and systems used in other games they have played (AP, FMS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Apply rules and scoring systems to promote fair play and inclusion when participating in or designing physical activities
Elaboration: Recognising unfairness and exclusion in a game situation, and proposing strategies to overcome these issues (AP, FMS, GS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Perform a range of roles in respectful ways to achieve successful outcomes in group or team movement activities
Elaboration: Using cooperative skills and offering encouragement to successfully complete a movement task, such as a group initiative game, partner passing strategy or team strategy (AP, CA, FMS, GS, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Perform a range of roles in respectful ways to achieve successful outcomes in group or team movement activities
Elaboration: Cooperating with team members and opponents when self-umpiring small-sided games, making decisions and accepting the decisions of others (AP, GS, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Perform a range of roles in respectful ways to achieve successful outcomes in group or team movement activities
Elaboration: Working cooperatively with team members to maintain possession in a game by passing to other players and listening to teammates (AP, GS, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Perform a range of roles in respectful ways to achieve successful outcomes in group or team movement activities
Elaboration: Modifying physical activities to ensure that everyone is included, such as changing equipment, rules or playing space (AP, FMS, RE, RS, S)
